text:
\begin{align*}
\mathcal{R}_{\boldsymbol{Y}}(r)&=
{\operatorname{Pr}}({\operatorname{rk}}(\boldsymbol{Y})=r) \\
&=
\sum_{r_X,r_W=0}^{\min \{ n, m \} }
\mathcal{R}_{\boldsymbol{X}}(r_X) \cdot
 \mathcal{R}(r_W) \cdot
 \rho \left( r_Y ; r_X , r_W \right)
\\
&=
\sum_{r_X,r_W=0}^{\min \{ n, m \} }
\mathcal{R}_{\boldsymbol{X}}(r_X) \cdot
 \mathcal{R}(r_W) \cdot
\frac{f(r,r_X,r_W)}{|{\mathbb{F}}_q^{n \times m, r_W}|}.\qedhere
\end{align*}

prevtext: Thus, using \eqref{chainrule}
text:
\begin{align}
H(\boldsymbol{Y_2}) 
&= 
H(\boldsymbol{Y_2}|{\operatorname{rk}}(\boldsymbol{Y_2})) + H({\operatorname{rk}}(\boldsymbol{Y_2})) \notag
\\
&= \!\!\!\sum_{r=0}^{\min\{n,m\}} \!\!\!\left( \mathcal{R}_{\boldsymbol{Y}}(r) \cdot H(\boldsymbol{Y_2} | {\operatorname{rk}} (\boldsymbol{Y_2}) =r) \right)
+ H({\operatorname{rk}}(\boldsymbol{Y_2})) \notag
\\
 &\geq  \!\!\!\sum_{r=0}^{\min\{n,m\}} \!\!\!\left( \mathcal{R}_{\boldsymbol{Y}}(r) \cdot H(\boldsymbol{Y_1} | {\operatorname{rk}} (\boldsymbol{Y_1}) =r) \right)
+ H({\operatorname{rk}}(\boldsymbol{Y_2}))  \label{useuniform>entropy}
\\
&= H(\boldsymbol{Y_1}|{\operatorname{rk}}(\boldsymbol{Y_1})) + H({\operatorname{rk}}(\boldsymbol{Y_2})) \notag
\\
&= H(\boldsymbol{Y_1}|{\operatorname{rk}}(\boldsymbol{Y_1})) + H({\operatorname{rk}}(\boldsymbol{Y_1})) \label{rYsame}
\\
&= H(\boldsymbol{Y_1}), \notag
\end{align}

prevtext: Using \eqref{eqH(Y2)geqH(Y1)} and \eqref{eqH(Y1|X1)=H(Y2|X2)}, it follows that
text:
\begin{align*}
I(\boldsymbol{X_2},\boldsymbol{Y_2}) &= H(\boldsymbol{Y_2}) - H(\boldsymbol{Y_2} | \boldsymbol{X_2})
\\
&\geq H(\boldsymbol{Y_1}) - H(\boldsymbol{Y_2} | \boldsymbol{X_2})
\\
&= H(\boldsymbol{Y_1}) - H(\boldsymbol{Y_1} | \boldsymbol{X_1})
\\
&= I(\boldsymbol{X_1},\boldsymbol{Y_1}). \qedhere
\end{align*}
